articles.description: PLO Secretary General Saeb Erekat has died, according to a notification on social media from the Fatah movement, as well as an official in Erekat's PLO office. CNN's Oren Liebermann takes a look back at his life and career.

articles.title: Anderson Cooper and 'Jeopardy!' rival share memories of Alex Trebek's awe-inspiring presence
articles.description: When Cheech Marin became the first "Celebrity Jeopardy!" champion in 1992, all he got was a small nod from its host Alex Trebek -- and that was all he needed.

articles.author: Eoin McSweeney, CNN and Orji Sunday
articles.title: The pandemic reimagined sub-Saharan education, but access to digital is urgently needed
articles.description: When Fiona Mavhinga was growing up in rural Zimbabwe, she woke at 4 a.m. and walked five kilometers (three miles) to school. She attended a full day of lessons and returned home in the evenings to tend the family vegetable plot.

articles.title: Houston police officer killed while responding to a call for help on his way to work

articles.title: Denmark to cull 15 million mink over virus mutation concern
articles.description: Mink farms across Europe are raising alarm over the mutated coronavirus among the animals. Denmark is taking no chances by ordering to cull five million mink. However, some scientists argue the fear over the mutation is overblown. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

articles.author: Analysis by Ronald Brownstein
articles.title: Why the Senate is so tough for Democrats
articles.description: The expected twin Georgia runoff elections in January that will determine control of the Senate encapsulate the structural challenge facing Democrats as they battle to secure a majority in the chamber that could determine the shape of Joe Biden's presidency.
